intro: Lechidium, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Melanthiaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are found in temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plants are perennial herbs with basal leaves that are typically broad and heart-shaped. They produce small, clustered flowers that are usually greenish or reddish in color. Lechidium species are often found in woodland or rocky habitats and are characterized by their unique, often toxic chemical compounds.
